alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Dawson; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Harlan; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Nuckolls; Phelps; Polk; Sherman; Valley; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:03PM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly 5 to 10 inches. Higher amounts of 10 to 15 inches likely for areas northwest of a line from Lexington to Fullerton. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH with highest gusts of 30 to 35 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. This will mainly be a snow event for areas from the Tri Cities north and west. A narrow swath of ice accumulations of a tenth to quarter of an inch as well as snowfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches is expected between Highway 6 and the state line, south and east of Hastings. * WHERE...Portions of south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From midnight Tuesday night to midnight CST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult in the warned area, and perhaps impossible in areas where snow is heaviest. Blowing snow and occasionally heavy snow rates could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will develop in time to impact the Wednesday morning commute and continue through the Wednesday evening commute. Lingering impacts into at least Thursday morning are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While minor forecast adjustments remain possible, forecast confidence has increased enough that significant snow accumulation will indeed occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
